content.description: Image © The Metropolitan Museum of Art / Image Source © Art Resource, NY
content.question: By breaking from Japanese artistic traditions with his use of perspective and a low horizon line, Hokusai was responding to

choices.label: the influence of European art brought to Japan by Dutch traders
the influence of photographs due to their greater availability in Japan
an influx of Chinese paintings due to Japanese military expansion
a surge of religious conversions resulting from missionary activity

content.answer: the influence of European art brought to Japan by Dutch traders

unit.text: 8: South, East, and Southeast Asia, 300 BCE - 1980 CE

topic.text: 8.3: Interactions Within and Across Cultures in South, East, and Southeast Asian Art

skill.text: Skill 4.B: Explain why a specific work of art (or group of related works of art) demonstrates continuity and/or change within an artistic tradition, style, or practice.
